intro: Hibbertia teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Hibbertia teretifolia is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and seasonal blooms.
